title: Analysts Agree: 3 Stocks That Are Epic Must-Buys
text: It's been a weird year. For all the noise and headache that 2022 caused us, 2023 has been off to a much stronger start.

title: Alphabet, Meta lure back advertisers as smaller rivals expected to struggle
text: Advertisers are sticking with safe havens Alphabet and Meta Platforms in an uncertain economy, their quarterly results showed, likely helping the tech giants take market share away from smaller digital ad sellers such as Snap Inc.

title: Alphabet Earnings: Google Cloud Drives Revenue Growth, While Ad Business Stalls
text: First-quarter revenue grew 3% year over year, beating the 1% growth Wall Street had expected. Earnings per share fell 5%, which was a less steep decline than the 14% analysts had projected.

title: Google: Double Earnings Beat And Undervalued Intrinsically
text: Google: Double Earnings Beat And Undervalued Intrinsically.

title: Sen. Warner urges tech to prioritize AI security
text: Democratic Sen. Mark Warner of Virginia on Wednesday urged tech leaders to prioritize security in their rush to bring AI products and services to market.

title: Alphabet Stock: Bear vs. Bull
text: Alphabet's Q1 earnings easily beat analysts' expectations. It authorized a $70 billion buyback and continues to cut costs.

title: ETO: This Attractively-Valued CEF Is A Good Choice For An Income Seeker
text: ETO: This Attractively-Valued CEF Is A Good Choice For An Income Seeker.

title: Google disrupts malware that steals sensitive data from Chrome users
text: Google has disrupted infrastructure linked to the notorious CryptBot malware, which the company claims has stolen data from hundreds of thousands of browser users in the past year alone. CryptBot is malicious information-stealing malware first discovered in 2019.

title: Google Is Just Fine in Spite of Microsoft's ChatGPT Bet on AI Internet Search
text: Alphabet's Google Search managed to grow revenue last quarter, in spite of "disruption" from Microsoft's Bing. Google is actually a pioneer in AI, and it has already infused its services with next-gen software capabilities.

title: Google parent Alphabet's receives higher target price from Oppenheimer analysts after 1Q earnings beat
text: Analysts at Oppenheimer & Co Inc have increased their price target for Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ:GOOG) after Google's parent company reported first-quarter results that showed encouraging advertising trends and a positive performance from Search.  The analysts maintained an ‘Outperform' rating on the stock with a price target of US$145, up from $135 previously.

title: ETFs Set to Gain on Alphabet's Q1 Earnings Beat
text: Google parent Alphabet (GOOGL) reported solid first-quarter 2023 results, topping both revenue and earnings estimates. Investors should tap the strength with ETFs with a substantial allocation to Alphabet.

title: Is It Safe to Buy Alphabet Stock Now?
text: Alphabet reported just 3% revenue growth in the first quarter, but that beat estimates. Google Cloud turned a profit for the first time.

title: Why Alphabet Stock May Be a Buy Now
text: Alphabet is an aggressive buyer of its shares. Should investors follow suit?

title: Big Tech Is Propping Up Stocks. Microsoft and Alphabet Earnings Prove It.
text: Microsoft and Google parent Alphabet have helped the Nasdaq Composite this year outpace the S&P 500, whose gains are almost entirely thanks to big tech stocks, as well.

title: Alphabet Investors Should Be Happy About This Q1 Result
text: This should give investors something to smile about.

title: Microsoft And Alphabet Beat As Investors Await Facebook Earnings
text: Pessimism set in Monday night after markets closed following bad news from First Republic Bank.

title: Leveraged Tech ETFs to Cash in on Upbeat Big Tech Earnings
text: Leveraged tech ETFs gained handsomely after hours on Apr 25 due to upbeat releases from Alphabet and Microsoft.

title: Google and Microsoft fight over the future of AI
text: Wall Street was able to breathe a sigh of relief on Tuesday as Google-parent company Alphabet and Microsoft both beat the market's relatively modest earnings expectations. The companies saw big boosts from their search and cloud computing businesses.

title: Alphabet earnings met with calls for patience when it comes to the AI race
text: Google parent Alphabet is in the AI race to stay, and investors need to be patient as that competition plays out, say analysts on Wall Street.

title: Here's Why Google's Report Is Just Good Enough
text: Last night, Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOGL), the parent company of Google, announced its first-quarter earnings, revealing strong financial results that beat both market and analyst expectations. Just like with Microsoft Corp's (NASDAQ: MSFT) earnings, the strong beat will be a tailwind for many tech companies who've had to endure a long winter.

title: Amazon stock advances as Microsoft, Alphabet results bring ‘positive reads' for AWS
text: Shares of Amazon.com Inc. AMZN were headed about 3% higher in premarket trading Wednesday after cloud-computing rivals Microsoft Corp. MSFT and Alphabet Inc. GOOG GOOGL delivered what Roth MKM analyst Rohit Kulkarni deemed “better-than-feared” signals overnight. He saw “positive reads” for Amazon's AWS business as Microsoft saw its Azure cloud computing business slow to 31% constant-currency growth in the March quarter from 38% growth in the December quarter but predicted less deceleration for the June quarter, with an expectation for 26% to 27% growth.

title: Alphabet Earnings: What Wall Street Thinks
text: Resilient search and YouTube earnings bode well, strategists at Citi and RBC say.

title: Alphabet's First-Quarter Results Highlight Its Strength in Search and the Cloud
text: Alphabet's core search business remains resilient. Profits declined year over year but are still significant.

title: Microsoft Hoped AI Would Be the Key to Wresting Search Market Share From Google. Here's How That's Going.
text: Excitement surrounding AI has reached a fever pitch. Microsoft is hoping to take on Google with the integration of AI into its Bing search engine.

title: Nasdaq futures rally over 1% after upbeat Microsoft, Alphabet results
text: Nasdaq futures rallied more than 1% on Wednesday after upbeat results from Microsoft and Alphabet dwarfed worries about the impact of rising interest rates on the U.S. economy.

title: Alphabet's Cloud Profitability Takes a Backseat to AI Ambitions
text: Alphabet's cloud business made some money in Q1 2023, but don't expect predictable profits going forward as the company focuses on AI investments. AI was the real star of Alphabet's Q1 earnings call, getting more airtime than "growth," "search," or even "Google.

title: Google's persistent ad slump weighs on Alphabet's 1Q results
text: Google's advertising malaise persisted during the first quarter while the internet company also grapples with advancements in artificial intelligence technology that threaten to undercut its dominant search engine.
